text:
My mom makes a really good Macaroni and Cheese, and she is always being asked to make some for someone.  She is not really a Macaroni and Cheese person herself but she loves making it for people.  I tried Chuck's recipe this past Thanksgiving and it blew my Mom's out of the water.  Sorry Mom!  She agrees with me also.  I am originally from California and we had this restaurant in downtown Los Angeles called Clifton's Cafeteria and I thought that they made the best Macaroni and Cheese in the entire world.  Well, I have finally found the recipe for it.  Thank you Chuck for bringing back wonderful memories and for one of the best recipes on this site.  By the way, my Mom actually loves Macaroni and Cheese now, and is always wanting me to make Chuck's Favorite Mac and Cheese.  It is now my family's favorite too.

text:
This is not your typical shells and cheese recipe.  Very tasty indeed.  My family loved it and the leftovers were just as good.  Some suggestions though which most people have already mentioned:  The amount of bread crumbs needs to seriously be reduced.  Instead of 1 cup, I would only use a 1/4 of a cup with the 1/4 of melted butter.  This will provide a light garnishment on top of your dish.  Mmmmm...also add a 1/2 cup of milk.  If not, your leftovers will be dry as a bone.  A tasty bone, but still quite dry.  Happy eating!!!  :)

text:
Of all the dishes I have tried from this site, this is one of my top favorites, and my family and friends rave about it. I make it exactly as directed except skip the breadcrumbs and cover the top in a thick layer of cheese instead. It is interesting to read all the mixed reviews on this mac and cheese, because depending upon what part of the country you are from, people eat different kinds of mac and cheese. Some people like creamy and some people like it the way this one is made. The mac and cheese that I am used to making and eating that taste like this is made with egg. The cottage cheese in this recipe gives the same consistency of that without the egg, and I like that. Thanks so much! This recipe has really been a great find for me!

best mac & cheese ever!!  i eliminated breadcrumbs & butter.  i added lots of fresh sliced tomatoes (tossed w/ pepper) between mac & cheese mixture.  also added 1/2 - 3/4 c skim milk (per another reviewer's suggestion) & used fat free/reduced fat sour cream, cottage cheese & shredded cheese & low carb pasta.  gotta try to make it healthier somehow!!

text:
This was wonderful! I had about half a head of cauliflower that I needed to use up, so I cut it up, steamed it, and threw it in with some leftover penne pasta. To make the cheese mixture a little more creamy, I added about a half cup of jalapeno cheese dip (the kind you put on tortilla chips), then added a little cayenne pepper. It had just a little kick, but otherwise tasted like your typical rich, homemade mac and cheese. Very easy too!

text:
Delicious taste and good texture.  Mine was creamy and not dry - and not greasy like some mac and cheeses.  Other reviewers found it dry but I didn't.  It was not bland either - the recipe says to use OLD cheddar for a reason I believe.  Maybe some people used dry parmesan, not fresh?? Or maybe b/c I just sprinkled bread crumbs on top and didn't use a full cup mixed with butter?  In case it's useful to someone else, since we don't buy food in ounces here, my conversions are 2 1/2 c macaroni, 1 block of cheddar cheese (450 g), 1 1/2 c cottage cheese (or maybe could use just a whole 500 mL), 1 c sour cream (250 mL).

Rating:

userID:
513548
Display Name:
Chloe

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Amazingly delicious! Love the tangy taste and lovely texture. I don't know why some people don't like it... if you want Kraft Mac n' Cheese, it's much cheaper and faster, so just make that! I used low-fat everything: cheddar, sour cream, cottage cheese. I used large shells instead of elbow macaroni (personal preference). No bread crumbs/ butter, I used a bit extra cheddar on the top. Seasoned with salt and crushed red pepper, along with garlic powder, hot sauce is also a good addition. I used a parmesan-romano-asiago blend instead of plain parmesan, and added 1/3 cup milk. I don't like cottage cheese, but it's really not noticable- though you can see curds. Amazing-- thank you!  For those who love this dish like me, but don't want to end up the size of a planet, making this dish with 2% milk sour cream and cottage cheese, and 1% cheese (Cabots has a great 75% reduced fat sharp cheddar, you will have to grate it yourself, though), results in a very healthy recipe that tastes really amazing. Per serving (1/6 of recipe): Calories:333, Fat:9.7g, Protein:28g. 26% fat, 33% protein. Very balanced and tasty! This is what I'll do in future!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I've made this three times now and have tweaked it to my liking as other reviewers.  I increase the cheddar, decrease the cottage cheese and  I add  1/2 cup of milk as suggested by others. I use panko instead of bread crumbs, decreasing the amount and I decrease the butter.  I have found that if I make this too far ahead of time, it becomes dry, so I try to assemble the ingredients shortly before baking.  I've also found that if I cover it for the first half of the baking time and uncover it the last half, it stays creamier.  If after 30-35 minutes, the bread crumbs haven't browned, then I pop it under the broiler for a minute.  UPDATE: 9/15/10 - Made a more "adult" version of this.  For the topping, I used equal parts of panko bread crumbs and freshly grated parmesan cheese.  Added chopped fresh basil and moistened the mixture with EVOO.  The basil added a different dimension to this compared to the original.  Either way, this is great!

None
text:
This recipe is similar to the recipe for Mac & Cheese served at the Hoggy's restaurant chain here in Columbus and it is great.  Ratios of ingredients are slightly different.  I use 2 cups mixed dry pasta to 16 oz of Sour Creme and I substituted 15 oz of Ricotta for the cottage cheese.  Also used 24 oz of shredded Cheddar or any mixture of shredded cheese you would like. Finally uses 2 beatten eggs.  I mixed the ricotta, sour creme and eggs first then added the shredded cheese and pasta. Salt and pepper to taste.  Dashes of  Worchester sauce and hot sauce are optional but worthwhile. I used an italian bread crumbs, parmesian melted butter mixture to top it and baked 40 min at 375. Superior recipe but not creamy,  Add a 1-1/2 cups of milk if you want a creamier texture. This is a keeper

text:
I was skeptical and I LOVED IT!!  And I already make a mean Mac & Cheese.  I really like that you don't have to make bechamel sauce first.  My 4 & 7 year old kids loved it too.  I did use my stick blender to smooth out the cottage cheese because I didn't want my kids going EEWWW when they saw the curds.  There was not one complaint and my son asked for seconds.  They didn't even notice that it was different from my regular Mac & Cheese.  This will now be my standard Mac & Cheese.  THANKS!!

text:
I have been making this recipe for almost a decade now and it has made me a hit at parties. People request this from me. I misplaced the recipe a few years ago and frantically went through dozens of recipes until I found it again. Why the desperation? I have NEVER tasted any other mac&cheese recipe that comes close to tasting like this. It is a uniquely rich experience. If you like the homestyle mac and cheese bake (instead of the creamy type) I cannot recommend trying this enough.

text:
I made this as written with a few *minor* changes. I used full fat cheddar, but Daisy light sour cream and 2% cottage cheese. I added a tablespoon of dijon mustard and 1/2 cup skim milk, Panko breadcrumbs on top. This was easy and absolutely wonderful. It is not the drippy, artificially yellow stuff that some are accustomed to from childhood. My husband loved it, too. Thanks for a great *keeper* recipe.

text:
I made this once before making it for a party with a bunch of out of town friends.  They still rave about it, and I even made it in the crock pot instead of baking it.  I use light sour cream and 2% milk, low sodium cottage cheese.  I add 1 egg and when I bake it use 1/2 cup bread crumbs instead of a whole cup.  I also add 4 ounces extra cheddar and shred it myself.  Sometimes I throw in other cheeses I have around the house like feta.  Adding paprika is a great addition too.  Enjoy with friends and family!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My family and I absolutely loved this recipe. I've been craving S'MAC since leaving NYC. I couldn't believe that this turned out better than the best Mac & Cheese we've ever had. I used gluten-free brown rice pasta to accommodate our gluten allergies. As suggested by other reviewers, I blended 1/2 cup milk and cottage cheese together. To intensify the flavor I included onion powder, garlic powder, nutmeg, dried basil, and himalayan salt. Instead of breadcrumbs, I generously added a layer of mozzarella cheese on top. I covered and baked the dish for 15 minutes then removed the aluminum foil. After another 15 minutes I broiled the pasta for 5 minutes to thicken and brown the top layer. Next time we'll be adding meat and vegetables to this fantastic recipe.

text:
I have to say that I do not think this is as great as everyone else believes.  It was a nice, creamy mac & cheese, but lacking in flavour.  I picked it because I needed to clean out the fridge and lo and behold here was a recipe with all the extraneous dairy products I had on hand.  So with that in mind, yippee!  I followed the advice of others and added a little bit of milk and only used a bit of breadcrumbs on top.  Also, as others have mentioned, for those who complained that it was dry maybe used a whole 16 oz box of pasta as opposed to the 8 oz called for.  It was good and I will probably try it one more time, but for now, it's not a keeper. Thanks though!

Display Name:
Elaine Button

photo:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent recipe; take the time to read through some of the reviews and tweak according to your own taste. I doubled recipe, used as many fat-free or low fat ingredients as I could. Definitely puree the cottage cheese, all we have is a little Bullet so had to add about 1/2 of 2% milk to get it to blend. I used a big tupperware bowl and mixed all the ingredients together, then added cooked macaroni and mixed well. Couldn't resist throwing in a good handful of real bacon chips (didn't have time to cook some bacon) and instead of bread crumbs I sprinkled shredded cheddar on the top. I also probably added at least another 1/2 cup of milk to make the entire mixture a teeny bit soupy. Wow, what an incredible mac & cheese delight. Husband loved it. The only thing I'm going to change is next time go with a whole wheat pasta and skim milk. It is a definite "go for it" recipe for even a beginner to try. The folks saying it came out dry probably used pre packeaged cheese. If that's what you use add milk - pasta takes on a lot of fluid. Should come out of the oven bubbling like mad and need a few minutes "set" time. As the recipe is doubled I was able to make a 9x13 pan full as well as a 9X9 pan for a neighbor. Baked both at that suggested 350 degrees on the same rack for about 40 minutes.

text:
I prepared this one and another from this site at the same time.  The other was more complicated withmore ingredients and  a sauce.  This was by far so much better and much easier to prepare! We all loved it, including a 10 month old and 4 year old.  I will definitely make this again.  I may try whirring up the cottage cheese before adding just for the texture for the 4 year old who thinks he doesn't like cottage cheese.  It's a simple, delicious way to make mac and cheese!
*Also, for those who thought it was too dry, just add a little milk, and don't overcook.  A very few people said it didn't have much taste -be SURE to use a really good cheese and grate it yourself - none of that pre-grated, tastless, packaged stuff!  Makes a big difference! I usually use crushed crackers that we love on top for a little more zing.

text:
I really thought for the last 25 years of making macaroni & cheese I already had the best recipe on the planet...until I tried this recipe. It really came out fantastic and I followed it exactly as written as far as quantities and baking. I only added 1/2 teaspoon or so of Dry Mustard to give it some sharpness and a dash of garlic powder. And since I used lowfat cottage cheese and light sour cream, I added 2 tablespoons of regular Hellmanns Mayo to add some creaminess. After it comes our of the oven, be sure to let it sit for at least 15 minutes. Delish the next day cold!

text:
This is FABULOUS!!! I modified it a little bit to our taste...cooked a whole 16oz box of elbow noodles. In a bowl I mixed together low fat cottage cheese and sour cream, the parm cheese, colby-monterey jack cheese, a little mozzarella and some extra sharp cheddar. Used a little salt and pepper. I also buttered my baking dish and then mixed all together. I also added about 1/2 cup of milk, then baked for 30 mins, stirred then placed crumbled Ritz crackers on top and baked an additional 10 mins. AWESOME taste...my picky fiance said it was the best he has ever had. This is a must try.

**Cooking TIP** : Put the cottage cheese thru a blender or food processor before adding, in order to eliminate the curd-y texture and make it smoooooth.    Believe it or not, mac & cheese enthusiasts ~ the cottage cheese improves the flavor!   This recipe is not especially creamy or cheesy, but definitely delicious in its own right.

I'm sorry if I come off as extremely critical or rude, but this recipe was absolutely not to my liking! I have made Mac and cheese several times using different recipes from this site, some wer good, some were a little less than great but I have never ever followed a recipe this not to my liking. The end result of the product was so bad that I even took the time to make an account and review this recipe for the sake of others! My boyfriend who is the most non-picky eater in the world wouldn't eat it... Mind you he is the type of man who eats leftovers on a plate! Beware of this recipe, if you're really craving some Mac and cheese I suggest you to go and buy a box of kraft dinner instead.

text:
Some people complained about the texture of the cottage cheese in the recipe...I think I fixed that by pureeing the cottage cheese with some milk in the blender. It kept the creaminess without having the lumps. I also added some onion powder and garlic powder. It probably could have used more spices, I'm just not sure what. One more change was the breadcrumb topping--I omitted the butter entirely and only sprinkled maybe 1/4 cup of bread crumbs on the top. Overall we really liked this recipe.

I could not stop eating this!   I didn't have any parmesan cheese on hand so I used Beecher's Flagship cheese (from Pike Place Market) which has a slightly nutty flavor, but melts a bit creamier than parm.  I also added about a 1/4 cup of milk.  It was perfect!  I will be making this again and often!   If you are looking for a creamy mac and cheese, this isn't your recipe.  This is chewy and rich with a bit of crunch from the bread crumbs.  Yum!!

text:
So,  you love mac and cheese, right?  I assume that's why you are trying this recipe...look no further, this is your go to mac and cheese!!!  Scrumptious, cheesy, heaven on a plate.  I think the people who said theirs was dry might be using a whole box of pasta.  DO NOT use a 1lb (16 oz.) box of pasta! This recipe calls for 8oz of pasta!!! I'm glad I looked through the pictures first because I did not like the way the cottage cheese made it look, so I  blended 1/2 cup milk with cottage cheese to *smooth* out the sauce before adding it to the noodles I also used equal parts cheddar and  gruyere, added a little ground mustard and ground nutmeg.  I used about 1/2 cup of panko mixed with melted butter (sorry, did not measure) on top!!! Soooooooo gooooooood! You will not be dissapointed!!!

text:
Great.  Very easy to make.  I was looking for a recipe that tasted like a local stores homemade one- and this is it.  I wasn't sure of how the cottage cheese would tase (sometimes in lasagna it stands out), but it was great in this, blended well with the other cheeses.  The texture is wonderful, sort of like the types made with eggs- but smoother.  To me, the bread crumbs are optional (I put it on half- my kids don't like the crumbs, but I and my husband do).  My kids loved this, and they normally do not like my homemade mac & cheese.  They use to prefer the Kraft Deluxe, but not now- this is what they want.  I also added a little cayenne.

userID:
8673250
Display Name:
FamilyBoundMomDotCom
isPro:
False

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/778791.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I bought a 20lb ham last week for a terrific price so I've been trying to find recipes to use it up on. The other night I made this baked Mac & cheese and added cooked ham and cooked carrots to make it a meal. Topped with more cheese and homemade french fried onions! Yum!  I doubled the recipe for my family of 7.

I LOVED this meal! The only thing I would do differently is add more ham than I did. The ham added such smokey depth of flavor. My oldest did not like the cottage cheese in it. She's a visual eater. So she nuked it until all the curds were melted, lol. My husband is not a cottage cheese fan either but he had no problem gobbling this up. This is my first time cooking with cottage cheese, and I was hoping it would melt along with the other cheeses but it didn't. So keep that in mind if you have picky eaters like mine. Apparently the cottage cheese is used as a binder, so I will substitute with an egg or two next time...and there will be a next time...but with more ham, lol.

FYI, To make homemade french fried onions I very thinly sliced up a red onion, separated the rings and soaked in milk for 5 minutes (I used the milk that I soaked these in to the cheese sauce). Mixed up some flour with season salt, a little regular salt, and a dash of pepper. Then coated the onion rings and fried them up in oil until light brown. Salty crispy goodness!

text:
I wanted to give this recipe 5 stars because my dish turned out so well, but decided on 4 stars because I put my own spin on it that made it 5.  Firstly, I doubled the recipe because I was cooking for a crowd.  I then added an additional pound of pasta for a total of 2 lbs.  I added a cubed 2lb. block of velveeta when I added the other cheeses.  Do not be afraid of adding the cottage cheese.  It blends in seamlessly.  Also, I would recommend adding the sharp and velveeta when the pasta is hot and fold until nearly all melted and then add the remaining ingredients.  It was sheer perfection and everyone went nuts!  I really appreciate the recipe, because it is a wonderful base to build on.

text:
Very tasty. I was skeptical of the cottage cheese but it turned out great! Instead of normal cheddar I bought chipotle sharp white cheddar. The smokiness and spice of the chipotle really added a tasty kick!
UPDATE- I still love this recipe, but I made a few changes. I use whole grain pasta. I also blended the cottage cheese with the low fat sour cream in a blender with a few cloves of garlic to get rid of the cottage cheese texture. For the bread crumbs I toasted bread and sprayed butter spray and garlic salt on it before turning into crumbs. With these changes it makes it much healthier but doesn't sacrifice taste!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was tasty.  I love cheese and wanted it to be somewhat creamy so in addition to the sharp cheddar, I added an extra cup of medium cheddar to it and put extra of it on top as well.  I used about half the bread crumbs called for (maybe even a little less) and sprinkled the butter-bread crumb mixture on the top with the cheese.  I'm glad I cut it back because the bread crumbs do have a distinct flavor and a whole cup would have overpowered it as the others reviewers have noted.  I also added 1/4 cup milk as suggested in previous reviews and it kept it nice and moist.  I loved the cottage cheese touch and the sour cream gave it a little kick.  Note that the sour cream also makes it quite rich -- I found I couldn't eat as much as I normally do, but perhaps that's a good thing! This is a great alternative to traditional mac and cheese!

text:
Pretty good mac n cheese reciepe - i added another 4 oz of vermont white cheddar because it didn't look cheesy enough when i mixed everything together, and also added two scallions. I usually just make mac n cheese on the stove with just pasta, milk and cheese, but i'm on the search for an out of this world macaroni reciepe. i would probably make it again, but it wasn't much better than my basic mac n cheese so i haven't decided if it's worth the extra effort. I have to say that i like mac n cheese super cheesy, and this isn't really that kind of a reciepe. It definitely has more flavor than others, and i like the healthy addition of cottage cheese (which i abhore usually). Not super smooth, but i'd rather have flavor than the fake cheese smoothness (yuck!). and i didn't have any problems with leftovers being dry, as some reviewers have noted. just reheat on 50-60% microwave power for a longer time, and mix halfway through. All in all, a flavorful, decent reciepe (just add extra cheese!!!)

text:
This recipe is delish! I make pretty much the way it says in the recipe, except I don't really measure anything. This makes it end up tasting a little different every time, but we don't mind. The only thing I really do differently is that I skip the bread crumb/butter mixture. Instead, I just save a little of the grated cheese to sprinkle on top, and then sprinkle the bread crumbs on top of that before I put it in the oven. It still gets nice and crispy on top, but without the added butter! Yum! I will be making this for supper tonight!

Display Name:
Michelle Finley Baker
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3394220.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This has become a family party regular recipe for me.  The problem with this recipe is that it doesnt travel well.. you have to pretty much eat it right out of the oven, so it doesnt work for potlucks.  As it sits it dries out quickly, even with LOTS OF added milk.  Cooking it too much or reheating makes the noodles soggy.  However, right out of the oven This recipe is just like my grandma used to make.  I followed the recipe almost exactly, except I put the cottage cheese in a food processor to grind out the chunks.  I then blended into the cottage cheese 1/2 cup milk and other reviewers suggested to prevent dryness.  I also made sure to use REAL shaved parmesean cheese from the deli instead of the crumbled kraft kind.  I think this made a huge difference, and the dish had a bit more flavor.  If you don't like the "fake" tasting TV dinner mac and cheese, this is for you.  Extremely creamy, flavorful and smooth.

None
country:
None
text:
Unless you are a fan of cottage cheese, don't use the cottage cheese.  The taste doesn't come right away but more so in the after taste. IF I made it again, I would leave it out completely, use farmers cheese or ricotta cheese (with some butter for added moisture) in it's place or maybe just add an additional package of shredded cheese.  I like to use potato chip dips in place of sour cream for added flavor.  French onion dip puts a nice subtle onion flavor into this.  This is a good recipe in itself but may need alterations due to personal tastes.

I_LoVermont

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677177.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent Mac & Cheese recipe!  In fact, the best i've ever made!  I did make a few adjustments because let's face it -- Mac & Cheese is very forgiving and a great way to use up what we already have on hand.  I used radiatore pasta, roughly 10 oz of Cabot Extra Sharp Cheddar, a 16 oz container of cottage cheese, the 8 oz called for of sour cream, skipped the parmesan but used a can of cheese soup to help make up the difference.  I also only baked it for @ 15 minutes (just long enough to crisp the bread crumbs on top).  I find that baking Mac & Cheese for too long makes it dry out.  The result?  AWESOME!!!  Thanks MRSO!

I don't think it is dry, as others have mentioned.  It isn't a super creamy mac n cheese, but that doesn't bother me or anyone else in my family that tried it...great and easy recipe!

text:
MMM...sooo good! Chuck is a genius! This recipe was just what I was looking for! Outstanding flavor, creamy texture..nothing like many of the other drier versions I have tried in the past. I used 24 oz. light cottage cheese, 8 oz light sour cream, about 8 oz. plain yogurt, 8 oz sharp cheddar, about 10-12 oz pasta, eyeballed the bread crumbs, sprinkled a little extra Parmesan over the top and then drizzled with olive oil instead of using butter. The whole family loved it!

text:
I loved this recipe!  I did make some changes.  I fried 1/4 cup finely chopped onion in 2 tsp garlic butter and I added ~1/2 tsp cayenne pepper to the cheese.  I added 1/2 cup of half and half as well.  I also sliced 2 tomatoes and placed them on top of the butter and breadcrumb mixture.  Then with about 5 minutes left, I topped everything with some parm. cheese and when it was done baking, I broiled it until it browned.  Such a warm and hearty dinner.  Thanks very much for the recipe!

text:
I am not sure why this mac and cheese got so many good reviews. I am amazed at how many people had to adjust the recipe - and surprise! I had to adjust it myself when it came time to cooking it in the kitchen because following the directions like it says just doesn't work. I think that if I am getting a recipe online I shouldn't have to make any changes! Maybe the amount of salt, cheese, etc. I ended up doubling the recipe to 12 people and it just wasn't enough. Since I was making it the day of the party, it made me stressed to have to worry about it. Just because it has a high review with a lot of reviewers doesn't mean it's good, unfortunately. I'd advised to "shop around" for other recipes first before using this one!

text:
No one in my family is into dry mac and cheese which by the reviews this seemed to be. Rather than keep looking I just swapped the cottage cheese for 1 can of Campbell's condensed cheese soup and 1/4 cup milk. It kept the same mild undertones as the cottage cheese and didn't make it clumpy, it was creamy, not runny but not dry, perfect. The topping makes WAY to much unless you usually layer a 1/2 in thick crust on top. I cut it to 3/4 breadcrumbs and still only used half. I will try a cracker crumble instead of bread crumbs next time as it was a little too fine for my taste. Served with chicken fried chicken of this site.

This was excellent!!  I quadrupled the recipe for a Thanksgiving family get together and it was a huge hit!  I followed everything to the T, except, I used 1 cup of heavy whipping cream since I had it on hand (and a few other reviews I read indicated it's not as creamy as they'd like).  I separated the mac n' cheese into 2 very large casserole pans.  I didn't add the breading/butter mixture to one just to see if I liked it better with or w/ out that.  (since other reviews also stated the bread crumbs on top make it even drier.  I wasn't sure what else I could add to make it creamier with out changing the taste, but it was delicious.  I do think it would have been just as good creamier though!  So I wonder if there is something I could add to help that out, but not change the taste very much. Anyway, this was a great side for our HUGE Thanksgiving Day dinner!

None
text:
Mmmmm! I made this today for our church potluck tomorrow. I doubled the recipe, but  I really didn't need to! I'm glad I did, because I am sitting here eating the extra. I gave it only four stars because I made a few changes. Instead of adding the shredded cheese to the macaroni, I made a roux of about 2 tbsp butter and flour, then added about 1 cup of milk, 1 cup of half and half. I let it thicken and added all the cheeses. After I removed it from the heat I added the sour cream. I mixed the noodles and cheese sauce in 2 9x13s, topped with the butter and PANKO breadcrumb mixture, and browned it in the top third of the oven for 10-15 minutes. The Panko makes all the difference-I love the extra crunch! I will definitely make this again-it will be replacing my family recipe in this house!

I'm giving this 5 stars because if I had made it exactly as the recipe stated, this would be fantastic.  I always feel guilty over the white pasta and fat content, so I alter recipes to make it lower in everything.  Because of that, this was a 4 star recipe... But that isn't fair to Chuck!  His recipe with white pasta and high fat cheese HAS to be delicious!!!  This was a good recipe without those things, so I can only imagine how yummy and comforting this mac-n-cheese would be with starch and fat added! If you want an alternative, try whole wheat pasta and reduced fat cheeses and lower salt. Add a pinch of milk for moistness ~ Still pretty darn good.  Makes a big batch, too!

text:
I took Chucks idea and everyone else's suggestions and ran with it...used whole wheat pasta and all low fat cheeses and skim milk.  I mixed in sliced green onion and bacon bits with the pasta and cheese.  My husband was making spinach dip while I was throwing it together, so I added some fresh spinach too.  I also added a layer of sliced fresh tomatoes in the middle.  It came out so delicious and good.  I'm dieting and it fed my desire for some gooey, cheesy, creamy comfort food...and I was able to cut out a lot of the fat and calories with substitutions.  I think I'll add grilled chicken and diced ham and create a Club Casserole out of it.

I also think I'll try Chuck's actual recipe as a side dish for other meals. It is a very nice base recipe. I love that it can be made with low fat options!

text:
I just made this for my daughters Thanksgiving potluck at school.  So easy and it turned out so good.  Several of the parent's were commenting on how good it was and asked for the recipe.  I did follow other reviewers and blended my cottage cheese until smooth, added a little milk, and then I topped it with cheese.  One reviewer mentioned they use fat free cottage cheese and fat free sour cream and no one can tell the difference.  I bet it would turn out just fine that way.  I think I'll try that next time.  Really a great recipe, tasted like a lot of work went into it.  Thank you for sharing.

This recipe was very tasty and well-received by my husband & me.  A couple of comments, however:  Contrary to a couple of previous comments, my dish came out alot creamier than I expected.  Who knows?  Maybe I put more cottage cheese or sour cream than the recipe called for.  Also, I added about a tablespoon of cumin and a dash of pepper to the mixture.  Next time, I may add more sour cream (vs. cottage cheese) for that extra "zing."

text:
This recipe was good, but I tweaked it a bit.  I used three different kinds of cheese and 1 and 1 half times the amount of cheese as the recipe called for. I used; shredded sharp cheddar, shredded colby jack and shredded velveeta(comes already shredded in a pkg.) and then added the cottage cheese, sour cream and parmesan cheese the recipe called for.  I made the topping out of 1/2 cup cracker crumbs mixed with 1/4 cup melted butter and 1/2 tsp. paprika.  It was very good.  My fiance loved it, and he's a big mac and cheese fan. Maybe it's because his name is Chuck, also. ;) Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I am a fan of traditional Macaroni and Cheese. Unfortunately, this recipe did not make a convert out of me.  I was skeptical when I saw the ingredients, but decided to give it a try based on the rave reviews from others.  For me, the sole bright spot was the topping, (I used crushed Ritz & melted butter), aside from that, I was unimpressed.  I even added a shot of mustard for a boost of flavor, but even that wasn't enough.  It wasn't terrible, but for my taste, there are better recipes on this site, like Chef John's Macaroni & Cheese or Grandma's Macaroni & Cheese.

text:
After reading a few negative reviews, I was nervous to try this, but then again, it's pasta and cheese....how does it really end up bad? I did read that it wasn't cheesy enough so I doubled the cheese (maybe it's because I'm from Wisconsin though too) and skipped the cottage cheese. Instead I used a little bit of heavy whipping cream & milk since I needed to get rid of it. It turned out very good. My boyfriend said he liked it even better for lunch the next day after it had time to sit. We added chicken sausage to the recipe and it complimented the mac and cheese perfectly. Next time we will try adding beef & some hot sauce to spice it up a bit.

text:
I made this recipe as directed, however I used cheez-its(without the butter)instead of bread crumbs and added a layer of parmesan on top.  We did 20 minutes in the oven and 20 minutes in the smoker.  Everyone at the party loved it and took home all the leftovers, but I was honestly a bit disappointed.  I was really looking for a creamier texture and tangy bite and I just don't feel like this recipe delivered.  I have a feeling most of the guys liked it because of the smoke flavor, but I'm not a huge fan of the smoke and I think otherwise it may not have been such a big hit.  For me it was just ok.  This was really my first time making homemade mac n' cheese, but I think I'll keep looking for a recipe with a creamier consistency. Thanks anyway

text:
It took me several times to Master this, but now its an absolute hit. Everywhere I go where it involves bringing a dish I am asked to bring this dish. The key is really reading the reviews. I found I liked it better with more yellow cheddar, and I like to add some ricotta as well. I also used heavy whipping cream to help keep it nice and moist. My family absolutely loves it!

text:
AMAZING & SPECTACULAR.....would definitely be on the menu if this were my last meal on earth!!!  I usually make a double batch in a lasagna pan, and I sub extra shredded cheddar on top instead of bread crumb / butter topping. I recommend adding a 1/2 cup of milk to the pasta mix before baking (1 cup if you're making a double batch). This will keep it moist when you reheat it the next day. This is definitely a dish that will have people singing your praises!  Thank you MRSO!!!

text:
This is by far the easiest baked macaroni and cheese recipe I've ever made - just mix everything together in a large bowl with the boiled pasta and bake it.  Two modifications that I've made are:  using Panko breadcrumbs on the top (fluffier/crunchier/better texture) and using 1/2 sharp cheddar + 1/2 horseradish cheddar.  I've also prepared it adding chunks of smoked ham.  It's delicious and everyone loves it.

None
text:
To Freeze: Only cook pasta for 2 minutes and omit bread crumb topping until day of cooking. Completely thaw in refrigerator then add bread crumb topping. Cook as usual.  If you add the topping before you freeze it, when you cook it, it is too greasy.

This mac n cheese is AH-MAZING tasting and I always get asked for the recipe.  Sometimes I'll bake this and then portion it out and freeze it for a quick lunch for the kiddies.  Just microwave and they LOVE it! I like to use extra-sharp cheddar. Chuck has great taste!

text:
This recipe prompted my first review on Allrecipes.com. It's amazing!! My husband LOVED it. We are mac & cheese lovers and always try it at various restaurants. This was my first time trying to make it at home & it turned out better than I expected. If you like thick, cheesy mac w/a little crunch on top, this is for you! I was hesitant to try it b/c of the cottage cheese & sr. cream but it was fantastic. I also added like 1/4 cup of chopped proscuitto, it added flavor. I forgot to salt & pepper it & it didnt need it. I also added more of both cheeses on top & used Garlic & Herb bread crumbs. I saw other reviews state it was too much bread crumbs, I agree, I would use about half of the suggest amount. This is seriously my new fav recipe!! Thank you Chuck!

HOW is this recipe NOT number 1?

Literally best recipe in the WORLD!  Totally agree with the suggestion of adding just a tad of milk.

I like to do my mac&cheese "German" style by adding caramelized onions.  In Germany, they have their own version of Mac and Cheese and it's very common to add a layer of caramelized onions instead of breadcrumbs.  It's simply amazing!!  So I do both, add onions and top with breadcrumbs... yummmm!!!

Wow, I love this. It's probably the best Mac and Cheese I've ever had! I only made a few changes. I added paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper to the bread crumbs and a pinch of paprika and cumin to the cheese mixture. Which I did not use all of, there was quite a bit left over. text:
Looooved this mac & cheese. Super easy to make, really delicious. I did not add any extra milk, as other reviewers suggested, and did not find it dry at all. I also didn't find it to be too much breadcrumbs (as some others did) - though if you make it in a dish with less surface area than a 9x13 pan I could see this being a problem. I used panko instead of regular breadcrumbs though. I also only had 10 oz cottage cheese (instead of 12). Will definitely be making this again.

This is one of my favorite mac and cheese recipes! It's always a huge hit with my kids.  I read that some people said it's turned out dry for them so the first time I made it I used 16 oz of sour cream instead of the 8 oz it calls for. It's never been dry for me. I also usually add diced up deli ham to it. Thank you Chuck for this awesome mac and cheese recipe!

text:
I liked this quite a bit.  Mine came out nice and creamy, however I did use a bit more cottage cheese and a bit less sour cream - maybe 14oz. cottage cheese and about 4-5oz of sour cream.  I also used Colby-Jack reduced fat cheese and a few passes over the grater of parmesan.  I did not do the topping because I'm not a fan of that type of topping on mac & cheese and this topping seemed really heavy to me.  When we splurge on homemade mac & cheese, this will be one of my top 3 - thanks MRSO!

wow! this recipe requires a lot of cheese! i got to watch how much i consume but i cant help it because its so darn good! i didnt have cottage cheese, so i threw in some random cheese i had in my fridge (cream cheese and gouda). still turned out great! i actually melted the cheeses together then pour the sauce into the pasta, then throw it in the oven! cuts back baking time. oh after baking, i actually scooped the mac and cheese into wontons in a muffin tin to make mac and cheese wontons! pretty neat combo! :)

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674135.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Very good with a few tweaks.  I puree together the cottage cheese, sour cream and about 1/3 cup milk - then stir in the cheese.  It really needs a little extra moisture from the milk to help it all melt together better. I also add a little seasoned salt and a dash of dry mustard.  I use fat free cottage cheese and sour cream - and skip the bread crumbs -  to lighten it up a bit.  I have also tried a mix of cheddar with colby jack - seems to melt together a little better than just plain cheddar.

text:
I thought this recipe was disappointing and bland.  I was really looking forward to it because it sounded rich and interesting with the added cottage cheese and sour cream.  Instead, what I discovered was the flavor immediately disappeared when these two ingredients were added.  I added peas for added flavor and health since this isn't the healthiest recipe.  Honestly, I don't understand why this is so highly rated given it's overall bland taste.  I wouldn't make it again and will be throwing out the recipe after I'm finished writing this review.  I think there are much better mac & cheese recipes out there.  This one is definitely not a keeper.

5 star, with the following changes: add 1/3 to 1/2 cup half and half, change cheese to 4oz sharp cheddar and 8 oz american (it melts better and is more creamy) , bake 30 minutes. Omit the breadcrumbs altogether and sprinkle the remaining 4 oz sharp cheddar on top and bake additional 5 minutes. Everyone loved it!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I made this last night for a pot luck and there wasn't a noodle left!  It is by far the best mac n cheese I've ever had in my life.    I used cavatappi instead of elbow macaroni.  To prepare, I cooked 1 pound of noodles and used 20 oz of sharp + extra sharp cheddar mixed, 16 oz of sour cream, 6 oz of cottage cheese, 1/4 cup of whole milk, 1/2 cup of grated parmesean, salt and pepper to taste... use your hand to mix together with noodles. I layered another 4 oz of shreddered cheddar as a topping before adding the butter/breadcrumb mixture.    I took everyone's sugggestions of adding less cottage cheese, more cheddar and some milk and it was absolutely wonderful! Thanks to all!!

text:
Definately a recipe worth a try.  I too could have gone for a more cheesey taste. Like others I added milk, onions, used fiber enriched pasta and cut back on the bread crumbs.  I also used freshly shredded parmesan in the noodle mix.  My changes: I topped with a mix of canned parmesan and italian bread crumbs added some crushed red pepper flakes for a little kick.  And to get some veggies into this, chop up some yellow squash, saute until just soft and add right in to noodle mix, tip from Rachel Ray.

text:
I love this recipe!  The cottage cheese and sour cream make it healthier than regular macaroni and cheese while still providing an amazingly creamy texture.  I recommend using lowfat cottage cheese, nonfat sour cream, and then regular fat cheddar and parmesan for the maximum health benefits with minimum taste compromise.  This reheats very well, if you have any left! (We usually don't.)

text:
The flavor of this was outstanding.  I used my immersion blender to mix all the cheeses and then folded that into the macaroni.  This comes the closest to the taste of the wonderful "school mac and cheese" we love.  I saved a little grated cheese and sprinkled that on the top and then added the cracker crumbs.  I used only 1/2 cup of crushed cracker crumbs mixed with only 2 tablespoons of butter and that was plenty.    While super tasty, we found this a little dry.  Next time I'll add 1/2 cup of milk to the cheese mixture.    This is the best tasting mac and cheese I've ever made.  Thanks.

text:
The weather here cooled way down-went from 95 to 55 in one day-so I decided to get away from the BBQ and try this mac & cheese casserole. Great combination of flavors! Make sure to pay attention to the quantities in the receipe- 8oz of pasta not 12 oz and you will come out allright. Also add a can of evaporated milk & a teaspoon of dry mustard powder. Top with panko crumbs mixed with a 1/4 cup parmesan. Make sure to use good quality local cheeses and don't worry about the fat. Savor the moment!

text:
I tried this recipe out last night for my husband and twin brother...both are rather picky.  I took the advice of others and added 1 cup of milk to the recipe and used far less bread crumbs.  I did, however, use olive oil instead of butter as suggested with a small layer of cheddar cheese.  To add some other flavors, I changed up the cheese mixture.  I added cheddar, provolone/mozz, a small amount of shredded parm, and small cubes of munster since I couldn't located my grater.  Turned out great!  Moist, creamy, and reheated well the next day.  I think this would work well with low fat cottage cheese/sour cream as well.  Will try for the party!

text:
This is delicious. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that it is a bit dry if you don't add the milk, as suggested by other reviewers.  I made a double batch for a party and it disappeared before I even got back to my kitchen. A definite keeper. 

UPDATE 3/29/14: I'm still making this and everyone who tries it loves it and wants the recipe. I've used both low fat and full fat cheese and cottage cheese, and it's great either way.

I've also added spinach and baked it in muffin tins for play date food for toddlers and this was a real winner--pre-portioned, greens but still yummy. Very good. You can prepare this ahead of time, keep it in the fridge, and pop it in the oven when you need it, just add some cooking time if you take it straight from fridge to oven.

text:
WOW!  I know so many people have already reviewed this recipe, but my family told me that I needed to do it, too.    We have 6 children, so sometimes it can be difficult to find foods that everyone likes ... except pizza, and who can eat that every night of the week?  I decided to try this recipe last night, even though one of my daughters is a die hard mac 'n cheese hater, and it was completely gone in less than 15 minutes.  (The die hard mac 'n cheese eater had 2 servings).  Everyone was upset that there was none left & begged me to please make 2 pans of it next time!  This recipe has so many great things going for it:  It is a breeze to make, it is relatively inexpensive, and everybody thought it was worthy of 5 stars.  This was also the first mac and cheese recipe that I ever tried which used shredded cheese instead of Velveeta & yet was not stringy.  I'm sure that we will be making this again & again.  Thanks for a terrific recipe!

text:
I've made this twice now and my kids ate it after the few changes I made. The major one was to put all the sauce ingredients into the blender with a little bit of milk so there weren't any cottage cheese "chunks". I also used some crushed caeser croutons for the topping instead of plain bread. The last thing I'd recommend if making this for kids is to use half sharp cheddar and half american for a milder flavor.

text:
My family loves this!  I have made this at least 5 times now and stick exactly to the recipe.  Sometimes I throw in leftover ham and/or peas if I have it.  I use low or no-fat cottage cheese & sour cream, but a sharp cheddar for flavor.  We are not fans of cottage cheese, but you can't taste it or detect the texture.  This is not like a box of creamy sauced mac & cheese, but a more traditional baked version.  Took some to my neighbor too and her husband wouldn't eat it upon hearing the ingredient list, but finally relented and enjoyed it as well!

text:
This recipe freezes very well for an easy dinner. Make the recipe as directed up until the point where you put the mixed up mac and cheese in the casserole dish. Put it in a big plastic freezer bag and toss it in the freezer. Pull it out before work in the morning, let it thaw in the fridge all day and at dinner time just transfer it to a baking dish, add the breadcrumbs and bake. I froze several batches this way when I was 9 months pregnant last year and it saved us!

text:
I doubled the recipe because I took it to my mom's for Thanksgiving.  I used a 9x13 and an 8x8, spraying Pam on each so the dishes wouldn't be too hard to clean.  I used ziti pasta and also added about 1/2 c. milk, a little garlic powder, extra parmesan cheese, and a few tablespoons of light butter, hoping this would make the recipe creamier.  I lightly sprinkled breadcrumbs on top  of both dishes.  They were ready after about 35 minutes and I took a bite as soon as i took them out of the oven.  It tasted great.  However, by the time we ate the macaroni was dry as a bone!  I had lids on them so they were still very warm, but it wasn't creamy at all!  Unfortunately, only half of one of the dishes got eaten.  Tomorrow we are going back for leftovers so I am going to try pouring more milk on top and popping it in the oven again.  So as of right now, I will give 3 stars....if tomorrow goes any better, I will change it!

text:
A deliciously simple recipe. I like the "throw a bunch of things together and bake" dishes. I was a bit apprehensive about the cottage cheese and sour cream because I am a bechamel cheese sauce kinda gal, but I thought "5 stars and 500-ish reviewers can't be wrong." The only thing that I did differently was I added half an onion finely chopped. I like a oniony tang to my m&c, but that's just personal preference. Whenever I'm not feel up to making a roux, this is the recipe that I will use.

text:
Very very tasty! This was exactly waht we were looking for in a mac and cheese! I made the following changes, sauteed half of an onion in butter and garlic, added it to cheese mixture. Used a food processor to puree the cottage cheese. Added a 1/2 cup milk, used 1/2 cup bread crumbs and less butter. Mixed all the ingredients together on the stove before putting in oven. Added some hot sauce and red pepper flakes to the mixture. Added some chopped cooked bacon on top of the breadcrumbs. YUMMMMM!

This was the best.  It even got a "wow Mama, this is better than the box," from my 8 y/o.  It is so easy to make and taste so wonderfully cheesy and creamy.  I did add 1/2 cup of milk as others had suggested.  Also, I was out of bread crumbs, so I used crushed cheez-its, which gave it even more of a cheesy kick.  However, next time I make this (and I've already had requests 2 days after), I will just top with extra shredded cheese and broil a couple of minutes at the end, as I prefer that to a crumb topping.

text:
Very hearty, great tasting mac and cheese.  I use the Mexican blend cheese, I tried sharp cheddar the first time and found it too potent. I don't use butter and use Fat Free Sour Cream, normal small curd cottage cheese.  I use 1/4 tsp Kosher salt, 1/4 tsp ground black pepper and 1/4 tsp paprika for more taste.  I add ham (the thick kind and I cube it) and 1/2 cup of frozen peas.  I also add 1/2 cup milk to make it more moist.  Comes out perfectly delicious!

Delicious! I used freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, sharp cheddar, Monterrey Jack cheese, and Gouda. I added some chopped jalapeno peppers and Cajun seasoning because that's what I do. I was skeptical about the cottage cheese because I really don't like cottage cheese, but it was a great addition to this recipe. The recipe was easy since a roux didn't need to be made, so it didn't taste like the macaroni and cheese I'm used to. It was still delicious. I will be using this recipe on the regular.

text:
First thanksgiving together so you gotta impress the future in laws, right?Thinking there would be a large crowd clammering for mac and cheese, I quadrupled the recipe. Needless to say I have several tupperware in my freezer of homemade cheesiness, which we are ecstatic about. The feedback of this dish were astonished looks of delight and seconds, sometimes thirds be had by many. I did crush a couple fresh cloves of garlic on the noodles and mix before the all the wonderful cheese jumped in. Also I added about a 3/4 cup of half and half as suggested to increase the liquid. Some other slight changes, adding some white cheddar to the mix, which I personally believe was the clincher and throwing panko crumbs in with regular breadcrumbs.

text:
I have made this many times and it is such a great go to recipe! Adding stuff to it as well is easy and great for that left over ham, sausage, tomatoes, asparagus, or anything that you need to use up when making this recipe. I usually make a double batch when I make this mac and cheese. I use the breadcrumbs sometimes, but found that I like the French's French Fried Onions or comparable best. If I bring it to a potluck however, adding a cup of whole milk keeps it from getting dried out on a plate warmer. But a single batch with a family of four, with growing teenagers you do not have to worry about it hanging around or being reheated for leftovers, LOL! Thanks for the great recipe!!!!

text:
So, there are some people who like their mac and cheese a bit dryer, and some that prefer velvety mac and cheese. This one's on the dryer end, which I personally like. HOWEVER, I've modified this to incorporate some added creaminess by making a roux, adding cheese to it, pepper, paprika and shaved garlic. I add the cheese mixture to some added cheddar, sour cream and cottage cheese. This mac and cheese is perfect. I really enjoy the little pieces of cottage cheese throughout.

text:
I have not met anyone that doesn't like this mac and cheese recipe. I've doubled it, tripled it, even put a pan in the freezer for my boyfriend before I went out of town. Sometimes, I like to use smoked gouda instead of sharp cheddar and sprinkle a little cayenne in as well. I also always use panko breadcrumbs for the ultimate crispy topping.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is exactly what I was looking for in a mac and cheese.  The recipe is great as is and is also good with ricotta subbed for the cottage cheese, seasoned bread crumbs for regular, dry mustard or dijon mixed in etc.  I love the cheesiness, if you are like me you can add in extra to taste.  

Keep in mind when making a mac and cheese recipe what type of mac and cheese you are looking for.  Though the creamy, bechemel sauce based recipes are great for some I find them seriously lacking in cheesiness and texture and better suited for recipes where you don't want the cheese to come through so strongly.  If you like a really cheesy recipe however, this one is for you.

I never write reviews but this recipe is FANTASTIC !!! Very easy and super good. If your leftovers are still a tad on the dry side despite the addition of the 1/2 cup milk you can use a small knife to poke holes on the top and pour a little milk in. I love this version! I've made both straight and with modifications, and this now the only mac-and-cheese version I use. Rating:

dateLastModified:

helpfulCount:
1
userID:
7276757
Display Name:
countryguyinny
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
1
favoritesCount:
13
recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674147.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Has a more "tart" cheese flavor than, say, Velveeta and cheddar.   Unique but delicious.  And my name is Chuck so it really is MY favorite mac 'n cheese!

I mixed the cheeses & sour cream in a glass bowl, microwaved in stages to warm, then beat with a mixer to blend them together.  Then nuked and beat in stages until mixture was almost smooth and very warm but not hot.  I folded in the cooked macaroni with the cheese mixture in the glass bowl first, then poured into a round casserole dish.  Warming the cheeses helped with baking since the mixture was thicker than in a 9x13.  Also, you can ease up on the quantity of bread crumbs if you do this, as there is less area to cover than on a 9x13 dish.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2013-12-09T14:47:48.4
helpfulCount:

text:
I just made this for lunch, and oh boy! This was good stuff! I was extremely skeptical about using sour cream and cottage cheese (as I hate both) and the lack of a roux to make the cheese sauce, but this turned out fabulously! It really tasted just as great as my regular baked mac and cheese, except even creamier!

I did make some small changes as I wanted a healthier recipe. I used low fat sour cream and cottage cheese, and half the butter and breadcrumbs for the topping. I also blended the cottage cheese and sour cream in a food processor until perfectly smooth before mixing it with the cheese and pasta. The addition of sour cream and cottage cheese definitely increased the protein in this dish as compared to regular mac and cheese. With the minor changes one serving came in at just under 300 calories!

text:
It left a little to be desired as it doesn't necessarily replace my craving for restaurant mac and cheese. It wasn't exactly as creamy as I hoped for but I suppose I could making a white sauce first then adding cheese = more work and that's not what I was looking for. I added a whole head of broccoli, 1 cup milk, half the amount of sour cream, no cottage cheese cause I didn't have any on hand, half the panko (all I had), no butter... Just sprayed top w cooking oil and tossed it in a 8x8 baking dish. Oh yeah, and an egg. I would like to try it with cottage cheese next time and maybe omitting the egg will help w creaminess. Overall, very easy and recommended.

text:
YUM!  I made this recipe and followed it exactly.  It turned out very good!  I agree with other reviewers, only HALF of the breadcrumbs are necessary.  Since making it the first time I have made a few changes that I prefer...I use plain greek yogurt instead of sour cream (no difference in taste, at least my husband and I can't tell), lo-fat everything, added about 1/4 cup of milk, and I ditched the breadcrumbs entirely.  I do like to sprinkle a few tbsp of panko bread crumbs on top.  I'm pregnant and can't get enough of this recipe!  I have a double batch cooking in the oven right now.  We'll see if there is any left over for hubby and the kids. ;)

text:
I was worried about the cottage cheese...a healthier option but my kids frown upon it, so I used half the amount in the recipe.  Also, I eliminated the bread crumbs and 1/4 cup butter (again my kids like their Mac and Cheese moist and creamy).  Finally, the ingredients seemed to result in a mac and cheese that's a little too dry, so I added one and a half cups of skim milk.  My son LOVED it.  My daughter said she preferred good old fashioned Kraft dinner because it had less cheese.  She didn't finish 4 tablespoons of it before giving up on the richness.  I suppose this stuff is for REAL Mac and Cheese lovers.  The adults in our house don't eat Mac and Cheese...looks like I will be giving most of this stuff away to the neighbours!

Display Name:
F.Patel

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/543353.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was really good. The last time I made macaroni and cheese from scratch was 5 years ago in a high school foods class. This is a different recipe from the typical roux/milk cheese sauce. I was really skeptical about this recipe but after I saw all the good reviews I knew I had to give it a try. I did know that due to my likening of spicy foods I would have to adjust the flavoring of this a bit. 

I made half of the recipe.  I sautéed some onions, 1 clove of garlic and a jalapeño pepper. I added a tsp of paprika and oregano. I added ¼ cup of milk to the mixture and set aside. I added all this and the ingredients listed in the recipe to a casserole dish and mixed well. I baked WITHOUT adding the breadcrumbs. After baking 30 minutes in the oven I topped with a light sprinkle’s of cheddar cheese and the bread crumb mixture. The only thing I would change next time was to add ½ cup of milk because even though it wasn’t super dry it wasn’t as creamy. I would recommend that you cook it until the cheese is bubbling.

This was seriously very bad, and I don't understand the high rating. AllRecipes doesn't usually let me down, but it did this time. A cup of bread crumbs is WAY too much. I almost thought about eliminating them, but I wanted to make sure I made this the way it was meant to be made. The texture was awful and grainy with all the topping on it. The taste...it was tangy from the sour cream. Other than that, there was no cheesiness to it. It wasn't creamy. Like I said, I made no alterations. But this was a complete failure. I will not make this again. I'd have been better off using Velveeta.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
"Amazing" was the word used by my new (mid life newlywed) 17 year old Stepdaughter. I have been looking for the perfect mac/cheese recipe and this is it! I've tried them out of cookbooks, websites, etc and none have matched the rave reviews this one received as a Thanksgiving side dish. I doubled the recipe and used Seriously Sharp and Extra Sharp Cheddar cheeses, which I hand grated/shredded myself (always tastes better than packaged shredded). As recommended, I only used 1/4 cup bread crumbs on the top. I was concerned about using Italian bread crumbs b/c that's all I had on hand; but it didn't have a negative impact. It's important to remember to double the cooking time when doubling the recipe. Thank you MRSO for the best Mac/Cheese recipe any of the 10 people at our Thanksgiving table ever tasted!!

country:
None
text:
I was given a recipe almost identical to this one.  I've made it several times and have adjusted several times.  This recipe is great with low fat ingredients.  Additionally, I make with seasoned salt (instead of regular salt), onion powder, garlic, and without the breadcrumb topping.  This is by far and away the easiest homemade mac and cheese recipe I have ever seen and the great part is that it is equally delicious in lower fat form.  Also, try cutting the sharp cheddar cheese in half and adding 1/2 a cup of low fat mozzarella for additional cheesy texture.

text:
I can't stand "processed cheese food" mac and cheese, so I was very pleased to find this recipe. The first time I made it as is and it was good, but needed a little adjusment to my family's tastes.  I now double the recipe, add milk, dry mustard, cayenne and instead of bread crumbs, I crush seasoned crutons mixed with butter for the topping.  Delicious every time and never a scrap left.  Thank you!

This is my new "potluck recipe."  It's simple enough that I don't need the recipe to remember the ingredients at the store, and it's gotten me rave reviews everywhere. It's delicious and you don't miss it!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This mac and cheese is awesome!! The only thing I did differently was to add the half cup of milk so my leftovers wouldn't be dry as another reviewer suggested. This is a definite must. I will probably add closer to 3/4 cup of milk next time because leftovers were still a little too dry for my taste. I also added 1/2 cup of monterey jack cheddar blend as well as a 1 inch block of velveta, basically because I had them on hand and figured you can't have too much cheese. My whole famly gobbled it down as a main dish. We served it with fresh from the garden sliced tomatoes and it was perfect. My husband especially like the little bit of crunchy bread crumbs on top. I used about 1/2 cup of those and cut back the butter to 3 Tbsp instead of 4 just to cut down on the grease factor. My first time making baked mac and cheese and this is definitely a keeper! Thanks for the recipe!

I have made this 3 times now.  I put the cottage cheese in the food processor which gave it a creamier texture.  I also use the food processor for fresh grated parmesan cheese and freshly shredded sharp cheddar.  What a difference.  I topped it with more shredded cheese because my 3 year old didn't like the bread crumbs.  He also made us pick out the pieces of pepper, so I no longer put pepper in it, just salt and it tastes just fine even if I forget to top my portion with pepper.  This is a new staple in our house.  The best mac and cheese EVER!!!

This was pretty good. Not the best every, but I'll be making it again. It did have a bit of a tang to it.  -I used farfalle pasta, I don't know if maybe it had an effect on the finished result. -Added a bit of milk right before I put the bread crumbs on. Didn't measure, just poured a small amount over the top and stirred, probably less than 1/2 C.  I really do wonder if some people who made this used a 1 lb box of pasta instead of 8 oz, I didn't find it dry. The leftovers were a bit drier, but it wasn't like I needed a sip of water after each bite or anything.  I *loved* the breadcrumbs on top. I thought 1 C was just fine, but I like toppings :) I used the Progresso Italian style. Very good.

text:
Best mac & cheese I've ever eaten, the whole family loves it. I do scale back the amount of sour cream to allow the cheese flavor to shine a little more. Also, I use panko for the crumb topping, add a little grated parmesan and only make about 1/4 the amt in order to cut back on the calories. Also use low-fat cottage cheese & sour cream. Add an additional 1/2 c skim milk for added moisture that makes the leftovers still be sublime

I made this (what I thought was) exactly the way it's written. I realized once everything was mixed that the recipe calls for an 8 oz box of pasta and I had used a lb. I was confused, surely an 8 oz box of pasta would not require a 9x13 baking dish? At the last minute I added extra cottage cheese, extra sour cream, extra shredded cheddar, extra grated Parm...but wasn't able to quite double everything the way it should have been. It came out ok, nothing to write home about. Didn't seem to all melt together like I would have expected. Could almost see the lumps of cottage cheese. Will give it another try. Also, I used extra sharp cheddar, next time will use regular sharp cheddar. Will 8 oz of pasta really require a 9x13 dish?

text:
Thought this was really rich & had a good flavor. I made the following changes: used about 3/4 C of both sour cream & cottage cheese; added a squirt (maybe 1 t) mustard; added a splash (maybe 1/4 - 1/2 C) milk; used a mix of shredded sharp & mild cheddar & a bit of pepper jack; also used just about 2 T melted butter & about 1/4 C breadcrumbs over top. Thought this was a good change from the ordinary & a good meatless meal when paired w/ a salad or veggie.

This was interesting. country:
None
text:
This was my first attempt at mac and cheese, and I was very concerned about the use of cottage cheese (because I'm not a fan), but it turned out great. I added 1/2 cup of milk, only used 1/4 butter + 1/4 breadcrumb, and layered the top with cheddar. Instead of mixing the sauce in the pan, I combined it in a mixing bowl; by the time it went into the pan the cottage cheese curds were no longer visible.  I'll definitely make again (but not for a long time because this an indulgent meal!).

text:
This is a great twist on mac and cheese! I did change a few things though. I used about 2 oz less of both the cottage cheese and sour cream, 1/4 of breadcrumbs (Italian flavored) with only 1 tbs of butter. I also added just a little bit more cheddar cheese to make up for taking out the sour cream and cottage cheese. I also added about 3/4 of milk so it would be creamy. It turned out great! However, I think that next time I will use even less breadcrumbs.

This is a great hit at the firehouse. I add spicy Italian sausages, which I grill a bit before I add them to the mix. Also, I use Panko breadcrumbs instead of the melted butter/breadcrumb mix. A side of lightly steamed broccoli and you're done.

text:
This is the best macaroni and cheese recipe I have had!  We love it.  I didn't have all 8 oz. of sour cream -about 5 oz., so I added milk to make up the difference. I used both light cottage cheese and light sour cream, as well. I used less bread crumbs, about 1/4 C.   to lightly cover the top.  My son who usually isn't too impressed by homemade mac. & cheese ate 4 servings!  It's that good! It reheated nicely for lunch as well!

text:
Great recipe! I only used 1/3 cup Italian bread crumbs though and made the dish in a 8x8.  I did add a pinch of garlic powder, 1/2 cup 2% milk, and mustard powder per another reviewer, but I'll leave out the mustard powder next time.  I also used whole wheat penne since that's what we had on had. And I used Parmesan/Romano mix since that's what we had.  Before I put the bread crumb/butter topping on, I added 4 round slices of Colby Jack.  I baked it for 35 min. Even my 13 month old and 2 yr old loved it!!

text:
Gluten free lighter CROCKPOT version: substitute GF pasta, any combination of cheeses for total of 8 oz (I used low fat cheddar, extra sharp, and sharp cheddar), low fat cottage cheese. Since I had no sour cream, I substituted plain yogurt. Also substituted GF cracker crumbs for the bread crumbs. It went into the crockpot on low for 3-4 hours. It was yummy!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made this for my hubby & son tonight.  Changed it a little.  Used low fat parmesan like topping instead of grated parmesan.  Used shake & bake mix instead of bread crumbs because I was out.  Blended cottage cheese so the kids wouldn't see or taste the curds.  Used mild as opposed to sharp cheddar.  Also only used 5 ounces of shredded cheddar + 8 slices pepperjack cheese to give a little more flavor.   After cooking noodles until done, I drained them, then added all the rest of the ingredients to the pot the noodles had cooked in and cooked that over the heat for a few minutes to make sure all the cheese melted in good THEN added it to casserole pan.  That way I only had to cook it for about 20 minutes.   It went over well (especially for mac n cheese).

text:
Big hit with family! No bread crumbs so toasted whole wheat hamburger buns for 9 minutes at 400 degrees. Cooled - tossed in cuisinart with McCormick Italian Spices. Fantastic.   Also, since this was to be main part of meal, I thought 8 oz. of pasta would be skimpy for 9x13 casserole, plus I wanted leftovers. So I made entire 16 oz. box, doubled everything plus extra cheese (various in frige) and 1.5 cups skim milk per other suggestions. This fit my oval pan which is only slightly bigger than 9x13. Fed 5 adults plus leftovers.

text:
This was very good.I made some adjustments using what I had on hand and it turned out great. I used penne pasta,I grated a 10oz block of cracker barrel extra sharp cheddar cheese,added Kraft Classic Melts (four cheese) to it and only used half of the sour cream it called for,I added evaporated milk and on top sprinkled more cheddar and Kraft classic melts and topped it with 1/4 cup of garlic  and herb breadcrumbs which I mixed with 2 tablespoons of butter.I baked covered for about 40 minutes and then 10 minutes uncovered and finished it by putting it under the broiler for 2 min. I served with broiled herb seasoned center cut pork chops and wilted spinach. It was a great meal!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614284.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm not big on mac and cheese, but this was a well-rounded meal. As many suggested, I added 1/2 cup of milk, and heated the milk, sour cream, cottage cheese, and cheddar cheese together in a saucepan until it was creamy, and then tossed it with the pasta. I had some polish sausage lying around, so I fried some up and threw it in with the noodles. I added cayenne pepper and garlic powder, and the final flavor was satisfying. It seemed nice and creamy to me; maybe that's because I added the 1/2 cup milk and I used a 16oz container of cottage cheese instead of 12oz. It was a recipe that would go over well with kids.

text:
This is a very "grown up" mac & cheese (but not so grown up that the kdis don't enjoy it--it IS mac & cheese!) Quite yummy!  I use Italian bread crumbs, and instead of the sour cream, I use a pint of ricotta and one egg, as in more traditional italian cooking.  This is a great quick fix, and an even better freezer meal to pull out on busy night--I'll actually be taking it to Thanksgiving this year.

text:
After making this I had to go back and see if I followed the recipe correctly, which I did. It was good I guess, and very easy to make, but the cheese sauce didn't come together at all. It was like cottage cheese with melted bits of cheddar sprinkled throughout. I like macaroni and cheese to have a thick, smooth, creamy sauce, and this didn't come out that way at all. It didn't taste bad, it was just disappointing cause it wasn't what I think of when I think of mac and cheese.

Quick and Easy!  My wife loves it. I halved it, mixed in a cup of milk and replaced the bread crumbs with crushed corn flakes.  Move it up a rack for the last ten minutes to add more color to the topping. Things you can add:  ham, peas, onion or tomato sauce. Don't tell my wife but I did add a little more cheese then it called for.

userID:

Display Name:
The (Almost) Amazing Mammarino

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/47540.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The flavor was EXCELLENT!  This is preferable to other recipes that include eggs, which in my opinion weaken the flavor.  This was very cheesy!  Because I only had mild cheddar, I added the following to give it more "zing": 2 dashes curry powder, about 1/8-1/4 tsp. dry mustard, and 1/4 - 1/2 tsp. garlic salt.  (Yum!!!  I'm going to make it this way all the time!)  I am giving it only 4 stars because of the texture.  I prefer a creamy mac 'n' cheese, and although this was very saucy, the sauce itself was very grainy.  I did run the cottage cheese through a blender, but it didn't help much.  I wonder if shredded parmesan would melt better than grated, or if another creamier/better melting cheese could be substituted.  Also, I see why people added more macaroni; 8 oz. does not make much and does not fill up a 9 x 13 pan.  I would keep all the same proportions (because all that sauce really makes it good!), but increase the entire recipe by half.  Wonderful recipe overall; will definitely make again!

userID:
1358116
Display Name:
Jennifer Hilbrand Phifer
isPro:
False
followersCount:
3

0
madeRecipesCount:
23
favoritesCount:
54
recipesCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674136.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
EDITED: 7/6/10
I would give this recipe 6 stars if I could!  It's fairly easy to make and so good.  I usually make it every couple of weeks, and serve it with lots of fresh veggies!  In fact, I no longer use the recipe as I know it by heart!
This is a great basic recipe, and also very easily altered to adjust for what I have in the fridge.  Tonight I subbed Swiss because I didn't have the Parmesan on hand, and it was just as good.
Though I used to pre-melt the cheeses with about 1/3 c of milk, I now find that to be unnecessary.  I just add all of the ingredients minus the noodles to my 9x13 plus the 1/3 c of milk, then stir the noodles in.  The milk is important, because without it can get a bit dry.  I've also used half & half in a pinch, which was very good as well.
Please note that this is NOT a recipe for Velveeta type mac & cheese, and if that is what you are looking for you will not be pleased.  This is a rich, tangy oven baked mac & cheese.
Review:

text:
I'm so happy with the way this turned out. Specially since I added half a zucchini (raw)and 1/2 cup cauliflower (boiled)with a squeeze of lemon that I processed in the food processor. My kids are picky eaters so I have a hard time getting veggies in their system that's why I snuck it in this.  I didn't bother with the breadcrumb topping but everything else I followed exactly.  I just added the cup of smooth "veggies" to the cheese and macaroni mix. Delicious! Cauliflower and zucchini are my least favorite vegetables but you couldn't trace a hint of their taste with all the nice cheezy taste in this dish. I had seconds and thirds and the kids had seconds. I can't wait to find out what my husband thinks when he comes home from work and tries it. Thanks Chuck!!!

text:
I used Japanese breadcrumbs which make a very nice crust. But I have to say this Mac is very bland. Today it is so firm I will have to slice it and fry it. Perhaps that will improve it. I think there are better recipes out there. Update: SRIRACHA Hot Chili Sauce saved the day and made it a fantastic dish with a KICK. OK I heated the bowl with the Mac and Cheese in the oven, than added 3/4 c milk and 2 tsp of the HOT Chili sauce. Use less if you don't like spicy. I added some more cheese and baked it another 30 Minutes. Now this is good.

text:
I've never reviewed a recipe before, but this was so good that I felt compelled to share. I made it for the first time last night and everyone LOVED it.  I'm talking everyone had third helpings!  I followed the basic recipe, making a few tweaks based on other reviews.   I added a 1/2 c. of skim milk, as well as a dash of paprika. I also used Italian seasoned bread crumbs to add a little spice which worked really well. I used low-fat cottage cheese, sour cream and reduced fat cheddar cheese to make it a little healthier, but the taste wasn't compromised at all.  We will definitely be incorporating this as a dinner staple in our house!

text:
This was Great, it was tasty and even my picky eater (boyfriend) enjoyed it.  The best part about this recipe though i find is how easy it was. My father makes a mac and cheese but it requires melting cheese in milk on the stove top, and that takes ages and also ends in a pot that needs alot of scrubbing each time no mater how much you try to keep it from burning on the bottom.  Where as this recipe, makes very few dishes to clean, and those it does make are easy to clean. Also no need to be chained to the stove, simply cook pasta then mix everything togeather then stick in stove and walk away.  i followed the recipe exactly, and was very happy with the results, next time i will use slightly less crumbs, but even as it was it was great!  will be making again forsure!

This was WONDERFUL! Not like your traditional southern mac n cheese but SO tasty! My husband and kids loved it. Even my picky 4 year old liked it(trust me, that speaks VOLUMES!). I didn't realize I was out of elbow macaroni, so I used whole wheat egg noodles instead. I did used all natural light sour cream and mixed in some milk before adding the bread crumbs. I could tell it would have been too dry otherwise. This is a definite keeper in my household! Thanks for the recipe:)

text:
This is a great recipe!  I use different combinations of cheese everytime I make this and so far monterey jack and cheddar cheese is the best combination.  One variation I have found that we like better is melting the sourcream and cottage cheese down with the cheese before combining with the macaroni.  It makes it into more of a cheesy sauce for those people who aren't used to homemade style mac and cheese.

My husband and I did not care for this mac & cheese.  It tasted ok, but it did not compare to other recipes I have tried.  The texture was not creamy, and the taste was not cheesey enough.  Our friends, however, liked it alot and one said it was the best mac & cheese he's ever had.  But then again, he's only had the box kind!  It's worth a try, but if you like the cheesey, creamy mac & cheese you won't be satisfied w/ this recipe.

text:
WOW! This recipe turned out AMAZING! My husband does not like homemade Mac and Cheese and he scarfed this down. I only rated it a 4 because I changed a few things. I used Velveeta cheese instead of Sharp Cheddar because Cheddar tends to give a grainy texture to the macaroni. Velveeta gives it the added creaminess everyone loves. I also added a little half and half at the end to make sure it didn't dry out. Lastly instead of using bread crumbs I used crushed up Cheese-It's and that made it even better. It turned out amazing! My mouth is watering now just thinking about it.

text:
This is a good basic recipe which can be expanded on to suit your taste.  I added about a cup of milk because the mixture seemed a little dry. Next time I may add more. I also used a mexican cheese blend.... added a couple tbs. of garlic powder,eyeballed  the adding of dijon mustard, worchester sauce, cajun seasoning, and white pepper to taste. I also used crushed ritz crackers w/o the butter. My BF who was tramautized by his childhood mac and cheese, was hesitant at first, but really enjoyed it after trying it. This recipe is definitely a keeper.
